benchmark_details.name: BioBlue: Notable runaway-optimiser-like LLM failure modes on biologically and economically aligned AI safety benchmarks
benchmark_details.overview: This work introduces a set of benchmarks designed to evaluate LLMs in long-running scenarios inspired by fundamental biological and economic principles: homeostasis, sustainability, multi-objective balancing, and diminishing returns.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To test the ability of LLMs to adhere to safe, realistic alignment goals through benchmarks that reflect homeostasis, sustainability and multi-objective balancing.

data.source: Generated via simulations reflecting homeostasis and economic principles
data.annotation: Automated analysis of LLM outputs based on interactions

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on observed actions and their adherence to benchmarks over trials.
methodology.interpretation: Higher adherence to balancing objectives indicates better performance in maintaining model alignment.
methodology.validation: Each benchmark tested across 100 steps per trial with systems reset for each new trial.
